comments.author: Anne Campbell
comments.content: That sounds fabulous! I've been kicking around an idea of making a "fried egg" with fresh mozzarella for the white and a halved Sungold tomato for the yolk. Any ideas for how to bring in basil without ruining the effect?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hey Anne - your idea sounds delicious! One approach would be to puree and reverse-spherify the tomato, including a few drops of basil oil in the puree. Or if you want to keep the tomato whole, how about removing the skin and using a needle to inject a single drop of intensely flavored basil oil. That would be mysterious! Or, usually you would serve toast with a fried egg, so maybe some sort of a basil cracker / croquant / tuille.
